duties_responsibilities.duty: Analyze debug, and resolve firmware issues observed at domestic and international customer sites as well as at local and overseas development centers.
Triage and root cause system, driver, and device interoperability issues at customer sites.
OEM Spec gap analysis, firmware customization/feature development; collaborate with other engineering teams to analyze debug information and implement and deploy firmware patches.
Need based travel and stay at domestic and international customer sites as well as overseas development centers for extended periods of time (can be up to multiple weeks at a time).
Assist customers by running or inspecting their tests at onsite locations.

skills.skill: SAS / SATA / SCSI / FC / NVMe / PCIe protocols

education_certification.credential: BS in Computer/Electrical/Electronic Engineering or Computer Science, and 10+ years of relevant experience in software or firmware or a MS with 8+ years experience preferred.
Familiarity with at least one of the storage protocols such as SAS / SATA / SCSI / FC / NVMe / PCIe protocols is required.
Open to frequent and possible extended domestic and/or international travel.
Demonstrated ability to work as a team player, as a part of a local and globally distributed team.
Hands on experience with UART/JTAG/ICE debuggers, firmware debugging and protocol analyzers.
